channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for SC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for SC

item.title: Report X-2024040526
item.description:
Report X-2024040526

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-03
  • City: GREENVILLE
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS REMOVED FROM TRAILER WITH VISIBLE LEAKAGE ON UPPER CORNER. IMMEDIATELY PLACED INTO LINED HAZMAT TUB AND PLACED INTO HAZMAT CAGE. DescribePack: UNABLE TO DETERMINE WHERE LEAKAGE IS OCCURING FROM- CAPS ARE TIGHT, NO VISIBLE CRACKS OR PUNCTURES IN THE SIDEWALL. LIQUID IN THE PLASTIC BAG CONTAINING THE BOTTLE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE IMMEDIATELY PLACED INTO THE HAZMAT CAGE AND ORIENTATION ARROWS WERE RESPECTED IN THE TUB.

item.title: Report X-2024040462
item.description:
Report X-2024040462

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-02
  • City: FORT MILL
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler loading van notified QA that there was a leaking hazmat in their work area. Package was assessed and determined that product leaked internally due to a loose cap/broken seal. DescribePack: Package failure occurred at the seal on the lid of container. Seal was broken and cap became loose which caused product to leak internally. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was removed from belt line and place in a lined hazmat drum.

item.title: Report X-2024040353
item.description:
Report X-2024040353

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-29
  • City: GREENVILLE
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED IN TRAILER TAIL ALREADY LEAKING, PACKAGE PLACED INTO LINED HAZMAT TUB IMMEDIATELY DescribePack: CRACK WAS DISCOVERED TO BE AT THE ENTIRE BASE OF THE CYLINDER IN DIAMETER AND APPROXIMATELY 2 INCHES UP THE SIDE WALL DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: IMMEDIATELY CONTAINED INSIDE OF A LINED HAZMAT BIN
